instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> late 2011 weird lag?
threads.message:
I have this <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> that had the graphics issue, I installed a  Tiresias  and all works great, 

Problem is after a couple of reboots or just randomly when turning it on the machine runs really really slow with like a crazy lag on the trackpad curser and it taking an age to respond to any kind of app. 

Things ive tried, 

New HDD
different ram
different trackpad

installed OS catalina and os high siera and it does the same thing still, the only way I can get it back to normal is by restting the SMC then it will fine again for a short time before stating again after a reboot.

Any ideas?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> late 2011 weird lag?
threads.message:
Tried PRAM reset too?

I recommend you to test with known good battery (not new)!

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> late 2011 weird lag?
threads.message:
well bugger me!

It was a (New) Battery causing the problem,brand new only 2 cycles,, I swapped this bat with one from a working machine and the problem jumped from this mac to the perfectly good one I swapped batteries with!

Ive never seen this before, is it a faulty battery should I return it?

Thanks dude

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> late 2011 weird lag?
threads.message:
I saw too many weird issues caused by fake batteries.
One time, I got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with graphics glitches and artifacts; just because of f**g new chinese battery.
